source: 211.org, CalVet, 211 Connecting Point, US Vets, and California veteran service organizations

resources.name: California Department of Veterans Affairs (CalVet)
resources.description: State department providing benefits assistance, housing, education, healthcare, and veteran services

resources.name: U.S. Vets Los Angeles
resources.address: 11401 Vandergrift Avenue, West Los Angeles, CA 90025
resources.description: Housing, counseling, career development, and comprehensive support for homeless and at-risk veterans

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: 24/7 free confidential crisis support for veterans and families experiencing mental health crises, PTSD, suicidal thoughts

resources.name: CalVet Los Angeles District Office
resources.description: State benefits assistance office helping veterans apply for state and federal benefits

resources.name: CalVet Los Angeles - Patriotic Hall
resources.address: 1816 S. Figueroa St., Los Angeles, CA 90015
resources.description: One-stop veteran service center providing benefits assistance and supportive services

resources.name: Salvation Army Community Integration Services (C.I.S.)
resources.address: 832 James M. Wood Blvd., Los Angeles, CA 90015
resources.description: Employment services, case management, and supportive services for homeless veterans

resources.name: Victory Village Veterans Center
resources.address: 11990 Heritage Oaks Place, Suite 1-B, Auburn, CA 95602
resources.description: Support services for veterans, service members, and families to ease transition from military to civilian life

resources.name: Placentia Veterans Village
resources.description: Service-enriched affordable housing development for homeless and disabled veterans

resources.name: Veterans Village of Carson
resources.description: Affordable housing development (51 units) for homeless veterans

resources.name: El Monte Veterans Village
resources.description: Affordable housing for veterans with supportive services

resources.name: Mather Veterans Village
resources.description: Affordable housing for disabled veterans with supportive services

resources.name: Veterans Village of San Diego
resources.description: Housing and support services for veterans in San Diego County

resources.name: Wounded Warrior Project
resources.description: Support and services for post-9/11 veterans and service members with physical or mental injuries

resources.name: Sacramento Veterans Resource Center
resources.description: Employment counseling and training services for veterans
resources.source_url: Search results for California 211 veteran resources

resources.name: California Association of County Veterans Service Officers (CACVSO)
resources.description: Network of county veteran service offices providing benefits assistance and referrals. Call with zip code to find local office.

resources.name: 211 California (2-1-1)
resources.description: Free, confidential information and referrals for community resources including housing, food, health, employment, legal aid, and veteran services

resources.name: Hire Heroes USA
resources.description: Employment assistance and job placement services for veterans overcoming employment barriers
resources.source_url: Search results for California 211 veteran resources

resources.name: VA Greater Los Angeles Health Care System
resources.description: Comprehensive medical care, mental health services, homeless veteran care, and benefits

resources.name: West Los Angeles Veterans Home (CalVet)
resources.description: State-operated long-term care facility for aged and disabled veterans

additional_resources.hud_vash_program: https://www.va.gov/homeless/hud-vash.asp - Housing vouchers with VA services
additional_resources.california_veterans_resource_book: https://www.calvet.ca.gov - Comprehensive guide to benefits and services

notes: This directory includes major state and federal veteran resources in California. For county-specific services, call 211 or 844-SERV-VET and enter your zip code. Many services are free and confidential.
